Preparation of Plasmid DNA by Alkaline Lysis with SDS- Minipreparation

Solutions/reagents:

  • rich medium (LB, YT, or Terrific medium)containing appropriate antibiotic
  • Alkaline Lysis Solution I
    (50 mM Glucose,25 mM Tris-HCl (pH 8.0), 10 mM EDTA (pH 8.0))
  • freshly prepared Alkaline Lysis Solution II
    (0.2 N NaOH, 1% SDS (w/v))
  • Alkaline Lysis Solution III
    (5 M sodium acetate, glacial acetic acid)
  • ethanol at room temperature
  • phenol:chloroform
    (1:1, v/v)
  • TE containing 20 µg/ml DNase-free RNase (pancreatic RNase)
  • 70% ethanol
  • a single colony of transformed bacteria

Steps:

  1. Preparation of cells
    Inoculate 2 ml rich medium (LB, YT, or Terrific medium)containing appropriate antibiotic with a single colony of transformed bacteria and incubate with shaking for 12 hrs(overnight) at 37°C.

  2. Measure out 1.5 ml of culture into sterile 1.5-ml microcentrifuge tube (1).
    Centrifuge at maximum speed for 30 secs at 4°C, gently aspirate out the supernatant and discard it.
    Leave the pellet as dry as possible.

  3. Lysis of Cells
    Add 100 µl of Alkaline Lysis Solution I.
    Resuspend pellet by vortexing/by shaking vigorously.

  4. Add 200 µl of freshly prepared Alkaline Lysis Solution II.
    Close the tube tightly and invert the tube 5 times.
    Do not vortex!
    Store on ice.

  5. Add 150 µl of Alkaline Lysis Solution III.
    Close the tube tightly and gently mix the contents by inverting the tube until precipitate stops sticking to walls of the tube.
    Store on ice for 3 - 5 mins.

  6. Centrifuge at maximum speed for 5 mins at 4°C and aspirate out the top layer into sterile 1.5-ml microcentrifuge tube (2).
    Discard bottom layer.

    7. (Optional)
    Add 1 volume phenol:chloroform to sterile 1.5-ml microcentrifuge tube (2).
    Vortex the mixture for a few secs.
    Centrifuge at maximum speed for 2 mins at 4°C and aspirate out the top layer into sterile 1.5-ml microcentrifuge tube (3).
    Discard bottom layer.

  7. Recovery of Plasmid DNA
    Add 2 volumes ethanol at room temperature to sterile 1.5-ml microcentrifuge tube (3).
    Vortex the mixture for a few secs.
    Store at room temperature for 2 mins.

  8. Centrifuge at maximum speed for 5 mins at 4°C, gently aspirate out the supernatant and discard it.

  9. Stand the tube containing pellet in an inverted position on a tissue paper to allow all of the fluid to drain away.

  10. Add 1 ml of 70% ethanol.
    Close the tube tightly and gently mix the contents by inverting the tube.
    Centrifuge at maximum speed for 2 mins at 4°C, gently aspirate out the supernatant and discard it.
    Take care with this step, as the pellet sometimes does not adhere tightly to the tube.

  11. Remove any beads of ethanol that form on the sides of the tube.
    Store open tube at room temperature until the ethanol has evaporated and no fluid is visible in the tube (~5 - 10 mins).

  12. Add 50 µl of TE containing 20 µg/ml DNase-free RNase (pancreatic RNase).
    Dissolve the pellet in the solution.
    Store at -20°C.

Equipment:

  • Incubator
  • Centrifuge
  • Sterile 1.5-ml microcentrifuge tubes
